sentences.english: March Spring is warm, water chestnut green Mai Dang heart.
sentences.chinese: 又是三月春风暖，荠麦青青荡心扉。

sentences.english: That’s right, you can be open-minded and think that others are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，你可以是敞开心扉地认为其他人是错误的。

sentences.english: Releasing the heart wall could actually change your life as you know it.
sentences.chinese: 敞开心扉会如你所愿的真正改变你的人生。

sentences.english: God blesses you that you will be shot with Cupids arrow in a short time!
sentences.chinese: 神佑，丘比特之箭会在不久的明天插入你的心扉。

sentences.english: Are you willing to open up?
sentences.chinese: 那么，你愿意敞开你的心扉吗？

sentences.english: I don't need the wishy-washy thing.
sentences.chinese: 你不能敞开心扉对我，那么我也不要了。

sentences.english: The last few devotions have spoken to the very depth of my heart.
sentences.chinese: 后面的一些感想让我深入心扉。

sentences.english: I felt a twinge of guilt.
sentences.chinese: 我感到一阵痛彻心扉的内疚。

sentences.english: Open your hearts and weep with me.
sentences.chinese: 敞开你的心扉和我一起哭泣。

sentences.english: Petition: Jesus, Good Shepherd, give me the grace to open my heart to your mercy.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣，善牧，求袮恩宠于我敞开心扉接纳袮的仁慈。

sentences.english: You knock the door of my heart deeply.
sentences.chinese: 你重重地扣开了我的心扉之门。

sentences.english: I hope my love which is as fierce as death, can open your heart.
sentences.chinese: 愿我如死般强烈的爱能敲开你爱的心扉。

sentences.english: As a treatment provider, I've tried to be open to the changeability of my clients.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个医生，我已试图对我客户的易变敞开心扉。

sentences.english: Open up your mind and deliberately meet more people.
sentences.chinese: 打开你的心扉去认识更多的人。

sentences.english: The step is painful, gut wrenching and overwhelming for all of these patients.
sentences.chinese: 这一步十分痛苦，压倒一切地令所有病人都痛彻心扉。

sentences.english: Open your hearts, so I may again be closer to you.
sentences.chinese: 敞开你的心扉，因此我可以再次与你亲近。

definition: heart (as the seat of emotions)/cardiac atrium
in the depth of one's soul
(usually of sth intangible) to seep into/to permeate
in love with/to feel deeply attached to
